info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 11:20AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Prince Edward, northwestern Lunenburg and northwestern Nottoway Counties through NOON EDT... At 1120 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Keysville, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Farmville, Crewe, Hampden Sydney, Hampden Sydney College, Longwood University, Burkeville, Kells Corner, Rice, Rehoboth, Green Bay, Prospect, Tuggle, Prince Edward Station, Briery, Arvins Store, Twin Lakes State Park, Nutbush, Kingsville, Plantersville and Blevins Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central and south central Virginia.
